main event: On July 18, 1958, a round, white object with swift movement was observed in Midwest City, Oklahoma. The object turned north and disappeared several times.
interesting points: Observation estimated the object to be over 26,000 feet and moving south over Norman, Oklahoma in a straight line before disappearing northeast of Midwest City, Oklahoma.
The description and wind direction suggested a conventional balloon, but the swift movement of the object caused attention, ruling out a conventional explanation.
There were no visible air traffic in the local area during the sighting.
The observation was initially made by a family sitting on their front porch.
The report indicates data on wind speeds at various altitudes and a note about a balloon northeast of Tinker, reported by RACON.
sighted object: round, white object with swift movement
witnesses: family sitting on front porch, NCOIC Control Center 33D Air Division
